title: Marek Olędzki
text:
Marek Olędzki (born 25 April 1951) is a Polish archaeologist who is Head of the Department of Prehistory at the <a href="University%20of%20%C5%81%C3%B3d%C5%BA">University of Łódź</a>.
Biography.
Marek Olędzki was born in <a href="%C5%81%C3%B3d%C5%BA">Łódź</a>, Poland on 25 April 1951. Upon graduating from high school in Łódź in 1969, Olędzki studied law at the <a href="University%20of%20%C5%81%C3%B3d%C5%BA">University of Łódź</a>. He subsequently switched to archaeology, and gained his <a href="M.A.">M.A.</a> in archaeology from the University of Łódź in 1979. He subsequently worked as a researcher at the <a href="Polish%20Academy%20of%20Sciences">Polish Academy of Sciences</a> under the supervision of <a href="Andrzej%20Nadolski">Andrzej Nadolski</a>. Olędzki gained his <a href="Ph.D.">Ph.D.</a> at the <a href="Adam%20Mickiewicz%20University%20in%20Pozna%C5%84">Adam Mickiewicz University in Poznań</a> in 1999 under the supervision of . His dissertation was on the <a href="Przeworsk%20culture">Przeworsk culture</a>.
Upon gaining his Ph.D., Olędzki became employed at the University of Łódź, where he completed his <a href="habilitation">habilitation</a> in 2009. Olędzki was subsequently appointed a Professor at the University of Łódź. Since October 2017, Olędzki has been Head of the Department of Prehistory at the University of Łódź.
Olędzki primarily researches the <a href="Pre-Roman%20Iron%20Age">Pre-Roman Iron Age</a> and <a href="Roman%20Iron%20Age">Roman Iron Age</a>. He specializes in the study of the relationship between the <a href="Roman%20Empire">Roman Empire</a> and <a href="barbarians">barbarians</a>, particularly their military relationship. He is the author of more than 120 publications on these subjects.
